## Clean data
Remove special characters, URLs, hashtags, mentions, emojis, and stopwords

import nltk
nltk.download('punkt')
import re
from nltk.corpus import stopwords
nltk.download('stopwords')

# Define regular expressions for special characters, URLs, hashtags, mentions, and emojis
special_chars_regex = r'[^\w\s]'
url_regex = r'https?://\S+'
mentions_hashtag_regex = r'@\w+|#\w+'
emoji_regex = r'[^\w\s\ufe0f]+'
extra_spaces_regex = r'\s{2,}'

# Define a function to clean the text
def clean_text(text):
    # Convert text to lowercase
    text = text.lower()
    # Remove URLs
    text = re.sub(url_regex, '', text)
    # Remove mentions and hashtags
    text = re.sub(mentions_hashtag_regex, '', text)
    # Remove special characters
    text = re.sub(special_chars_regex, '', text)
    # Remove emojis
    text = re.sub(emoji_regex, '', text)
    # Remove empty spaces equal to or bigger than 2 spaces
    text = re.sub(extra_spaces_regex, ' ', text)
    
    # Tokenize the text
    tokens = nltk.word_tokenize(text)
    # Remove stop words
    stopwords_list = stopwords.words('english')
    tokens = [token for token in tokens if token not in stopwords_list]
    # Remove any remaining noise
    tokens = [re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', ' ', token) for token in tokens]
    return ' '.join(tokens)

# Define a UDF to apply the clean_text function
clean_text_udf = udf(clean_text, StringType())

# Apply the clean_text function to the text column and add the cleaned text to a new column cleanText
df = df.withColumn('cleanText', clean_text_udf(df['text']))
display(df)

## Perform Topic Modeling
## Pyspark ML Clustering LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation)
https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.clustering.LDA.html
## 5 Topics

from pyspark.ml.feature import Tokenizer, CountVectorizer
from pyspark.ml.clustering import LDA

# tokenize text
tokenizer = Tokenizer(inputCol='cleanText', outputCol='tokens')
df_tokens = tokenizer.transform(df)

# create document-term matrix
vectorizer = CountVectorizer(inputCol='tokens', outputCol='features')
model = vectorizer.fit(df_tokens)
df_features = model.transform(df_tokens)

# fit LDA model
num_topics = 5
max_iterations = 10
lda = LDA(k=num_topics, maxIter=max_iterations)
lda_model = lda.fit(df_features)

# get topic distribution for each document
df_topics = lda_model.transform(df_features).select('id', 'topicDistribution')

# join with original DataFrame
df_result = df.join(df_topics, 'id')

#display(df_result)
## Parse topicDistribution output column for the topic group and confidence values

import json
import numpy as np

# Extract the 'replies' column and convert it to JSON
json_output = df_result.select("topicDistribution").toJSON().collect()

# Deserialize the JSON and extract the 'replies' field
topics = [json.loads(x)["topicDistribution"] for x in json_output]

topicgroup = []
topic0confidence = []
topic1confidence = []
topic2confidence = []
topic3confidence = []
topic4confidence = []

# Print the 'replies' field for each row
for topic in topics:
    #print(topic)
    
    # convert JSON array to numpy array
    arr = np.array(topic['values'])
    topic0confidence.append(arr[0])
    topic1confidence.append(arr[1])
    topic2confidence.append(arr[2])
    topic3confidence.append(arr[3])
    topic4confidence.append(arr[4])

    # find index of maximum value
    idx = np.argmax(arr)
    #print(idx)
    topicgroup.append(idx)

#print(topicgroup)
#print(topic0confidence)
#print(topic1confidence)
#print(topic2confidence)
#print(topic3confidence)
#print(topic4confidence)

    text_values.append(row["text"])
    lang_values.append(row["lang"])
    retweet_count_values.append(row["retweet_count"])
    reply_count_values.append(row["reply_count"])
    like_count_values.append(row["like_count"])
    quote_count_values.append(row["quote_count"])
    impression_count_values.append(row["impression_count"])
    cleantext_values.append(row['cleanText'])
## Convert new values to proper int of float data types

# Convert nump.int64 to int and numpy.float64 to float
topicgroup = [int(i) for i in topicgroup]
topic0confidence = [float(i) for i in topic0confidence]
topic1confidence = [float(i) for i in topic1confidence]
topic2confidence = [float(i) for i in topic2confidence]
topic3confidence = [float(i) for i in topic3confidence]
topic4confidence = [float(i) for i in topic4confidence]
## Create a final output dataframe by mapping the values to their proper schema

from pyspark.sql.types import *
schema = StructType([
    StructField("id",  LongType(), True),
    StructField("created_at", TimestampType(), True),
    StructField("text", StringType(), True),
    StructField("cleantext", StringType(), True),
    StructField("lang", StringType(), True),
    StructField("retweet_count", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("reply_count", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("like_count", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("quote_count", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("impression_count", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("topic", ShortType(), True),
    StructField("topic_0_confidence", FloatType(), True),
    StructField("topic_1_confidence", FloatType(), True),
    StructField("topic_2_confidence", FloatType(), True),
    StructField("topic_3_confidence", FloatType(), True),
    StructField("topic_4_confidence", FloatType(), True)
])

# create rows
rows = [Row(id=id_values[i],
            created_at=created_at_values[i],
            text=text_values[i],
            cleanText = cleantext_values[i],
            lang=lang_values[i],
            retweet_count = retweet_count_values[i],
            reply_count=reply_count_values[i],
            like_count=like_count_values[i],
            quote_count=quote_count_values[i],
            impression_count = impression_count_values[i],
            topic = topicgroup[i],
            topic_0_confidence = topic0confidence[i],
            topic_1_confidence = topic1confidence[i],
            topic_2_confidence = topic2confidence[i],
            topic_3_confidence = topic3confidence[i],
            topic_4_confidence = topic4confidence[i])
        for i in range(len(id_values))]

# create a DataFrame
final_topic_df = spark.createDataFrame(rows, schema)
